thread.title: stanton

author: stanton
title: stanton
text:
It's a fine grinder, not loud or whiny, and seems heavy duty for home use. I wish however there were a receptacle designed for doserless use. The metal curved bar below where the grinds come out below the chute is non removable; I put a bowl below it. This is ok because it's clearly designed for an espresso doser - the use for drip/french press is less thought out.
My old solis (fiinally bit the dust (pun?) after 10 years after its internal gears stripped; I expect and hope this unit lasts long.
Rocky is superior to the solis (espresso grind), equal (drip grind, countertop footprint), and seems by sheer weight to be sturdier. Will write back hopefully after >>10 years to report on superior longevity :)
